frameDefinitions: An Agent performs a Response action in consequence of a Trigger event.
A New_member becomes a member of a socially-constructed Group.
A Protagonist is sensitive to a Trigger, which has the potential to cause some kind of reaction in the Protagonist.  '' 'Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are allergic to cats.'
A Speaker uses a particular linguistic form, a Name to refer to an Entity.

This frame deals with a Speaker communicating a reply or response, a Message, to some prior communication or action, the Trigger.  '' 'The landlord has not yet replied in writing to the tenant objecting the proposed alterations.
Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.
frameExamples: I <t>respond</t> to earthquakes by hiding under my desk.
Seven new members and the three countries <t>joined</t> the alliance five years ago.
Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are <t>allergic</t> to cats.
They corresponded frequently and at length, exchanging intimate letters in which he <t>addressed</t> her as Windflower.
The landlord has not yet <t>replied</t> in writing to the tenant objecting the proposed alterations.DNI

A mulberry is very <t>similar</t> in shape
to a loganberry
listRoleDefinitions: The means action whereby the <fen>Agent</fen> responds to the Trigger.
A non-agentive entity that is impinged upon by a <fen>Trigger</fen> event to which they respond.
An event that impinges upon the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Responding_entity</fen> and produces a <fen>Response</fen> from it.
The intentional <fen>Agent</fen> that is impinged upon by a <fen>Trigger</fen> event to which they respond.
The point in time when the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Responding_entity</fen> manifests its <fen>Response</fen> to the <fen>Trigger</fen> .
The location in which the <fen>Response</fen> action takes place.
The <fen>New_member</fen> becomes a member of a (socially-defined) <fen>Group</fen>.
The <fen>Group</fen> is a socially-constructed entity composed of members.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>New_member</fen> joins the <fen>Group</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the joining occurs.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> occurs as the External Argument of the targets in this frame. The <fen>Protagonist</fen> represents the one exhibiting the response to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.

The <fen>Trigger</fen> most commonly occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment>. The <fen>Trigger</fen> is that substance or element which causes a health response in the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
The person who uses the <fen>Name</fen>  to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The entity that is designated by the <fen>Speaker</fen> with the <fen>Name</fen> used.
The linguistic form used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The point of time or interval when the <fen>Speaker</fen> uses the <fen>Name</fen>.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that communicates the reply or response. It is expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of a <t>Target</t> verb or as the Genitive modifier of a <t>Target</t> noun:
This is the person to whom the response is communicated.  When expressed, this role occurs as the direct object of a <t>Target</t> verb, or in a prepositional phrase introduced by 'to':
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a direct quote or a clause.
<fen>Topic</fen> occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun <t>Target</t>:
The <fen>Trigger</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given. It can occur as an NP Object or a PP Complement.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known.  <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities.  (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.
The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists
listRoleExamples: The diocese responded <fex>by taking the property</fex>
<fex>This plastic</fex> responds well to pressure.
How has the modern welfare state responded <fex>to the needs of working class women</fex>, and why?
Once again <fex>the Government</fex> is responding to a crisis with measures that will only harm patients
Israel responded <fex>yesterday</fex> to the killing of 22 people by Palestinian suicide bombers with a helicopter attack

The auto industry has responded <fex>in the U.S., but particularly in Asian and European markets</fex> by manufacturing an entry-level segment of cars that is more appealing, better looking, and safer than in the past.
Have <fex>you</fex> signed up for the new Medicare Prescription program?
Please join <fex>our club</fex>! CNI
An avid skier myself, I ventured to Aspen and enrolled in Nevin's school <fex>last winter</fex> to see what all the fuss was about.
<fex>Pat's</fex> allergy to dairy products is severe.
Some people are very sensitive <fex>to chemicals in the environment</fex>.
<fex>The Lord, who was charmed by her beauty,</fex> addressed her as 'than kaadhali!' (My darling) and hence the name.
And that's the reason why we called <fex>him</fex> 'Tom' when his real name was actually John.
A male voice answered the call, and Jones addressed the man as <fex>'Johnny.'</fex>
No one had <fex>ever</fex> called her 'my lady'.
<fex>Sue</fex> responded to the objection convincingly.
Sue answered <fex>Bob</fex> immediately.
<fex>'I can't help you,'</fex> Sue answered.
My boss still hasn't given me an answer <fex>about a promotion</fex>.
Sue answered <fex>the question</fex>.
A reminder letter was sent to all nonrespondents who had not replied <fex>after 28 days</fex>.
This was how Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa responded <fex>in the Assembly</fex> on November 5, 2003.
<fex>The two painters</fex> were alike in being unable to draw acceptably .
In the first phase <fex>Barthes's approach</fex> has similarities to that of Levi-Strauss.
The results of Method 2 show remarkable similarity <fex>to those obtained by Method 1</fex>
The disc announced Friday is <fex>physically</fex> similar to current music CDs
His presidency was different <fex>in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .
